channel.title: Lucid Dreaming
channel.description:
I thought I would share my experiences on Lucid Dreaming.
I've tried to achieve lucidity multiple times. I figured it would help with my depression, letting me do all the things I never could, etc. It hasn't been until this past month that I've been able to truly maintain control of my dreams.
My house was unfurnished; nobody was home. I walk out my front door, and neither God nor man could have fathomed the glory of the land. I only wish I could describe it. It appeared to be night, but there was still light everywhere. The sky was littered with stars, and planets that seemed about as close as the size of a CD at arms length. I walked for a bit. I knew I could do whatever I wanted, like flying, but I felt compelled to walk. I travel and notice a house on a grassy knoll just off the distance. I head towards it, eager to know what it was. As I got closer, I immediately regretted approaching it. I felt darkness. I knew it was a bad idea, but I went in. It seemed like a typical creepy house. Floors creaked, broken windows, and I hated it. I turned around to leave, but I was suddenly rigid. I wanted more than ever to leave, but I couldn't. Then, the sickest, most wretched laugh came from behind me, and I was awoken. I haven't tried lucid dreaming since. From what I've looked up, usually these kinds of occurrences are something that's troubling someone in the subconscious, but I don't ever want to go back.
Have any of you experienced lucidity, and if so, had better experiences than I?

item.title: Lucid Dreaming
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

m1lkman:

and went into my parents bedroom and fell asleep. The dream resumed and I peed again.

Read full topic

item.title: Lucid Dreaming
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

I know but the tingly feeling is fun c: That and I also really want to experience the vibrations for myself.

Read full topic

item.title: Lucid Dreaming
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

rip4d:

MEH. Alright, so for whatever reason I can’t achieve full sleep paralysis. I get to my torso and I break from it unintentionally, and then I get frustrated and just fall asleep. Any tips?

You DONT NEED to do this to achieve lucid dreaming… Someone said it CAN help, i’ve lucid dreamed many a time and I’ve never used sleep paralysis to achieve it. You don’t need it so don’t worry about it…

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:

MEH. Alright, so for whatever reason I can’t achieve full sleep paralysis. I get to my torso and I break from it unintentionally, and then I get frustrated and just fall asleep. Any tips?

item.title: Lucid Dreaming
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

I remember this one time I got sick (I was really young) and that cartoon called “Foster’s home for Imaginary Friends” had just come out. I was dreaming about it and for some reason I was horrified but it wasn’t scary at all. I peed my bed and went into my parents bedroom and fell asleep. The dream resumed and I peed again. I never realized I peed until I woke up that morning.

Read full topic

item.title: Lucid Dreaming
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

zuppers:

Has anyone had the same dream over and over again for the period of lets say a week?

Yea, whenever I get really sick I have the same dream over multiple nights. One may have a small variation, however the premise stays the same.

Read full topic

item.title: Lucid Dreaming
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“TheHolyGrail, post:45, topic:441739”][quote author=The Wanderer link=topic=544427.msg3992057#msg3992057 date=1336714609]
If you can’t remember your dreams, can you lucid dream? For I hardly ever remember my dreams.
[/quote]Write your dreams down right after, make a journal of them or something. ;)[/quote]
It’s not that I forget them over a period of time, it is more like I just wake up. I don’t think of anything that i was dreaming about or anything. I just open my eyes or if someone wakes me up (weekdays) I just go take a shower. Every once in a blue moon I remember my dreams, like yesterday I remember I had a dream and it was about me somehow being stuck in a marching band when they needed me on the field. Then I just opened my eyes and took a shower because I was basically done with the dream.

Read full topic

item.title: Lucid Dreaming
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote="-Nothing, post:56, topic:441739"]Anybody else have dreams that are connected to eachother? I had a dream where I stole a dirt bike, and I hid it in some random garage in middle of a forest, and in other dream I went there to drive it.[/quote]I love when that happens! I feel like i have a town in my dreams that keep recurring, and its awesome when I remeber parts of it in my dreams.

Read full topic

item.title: Lucid Dreaming
item.dc:creator: @kickingjamie kickingjamie
item.description:
@kickingjamie wrote:

Would love to be able to do this… I can imagine my first one ever ;). I would have so much to do whilst dreaming I probably wouldn’t be able to dream long enough.

I never really have dreams that I remember though :(.

Read full topic

item.title: Lucid Dreaming
item.dc:creator: @Int_Bauk Int Bauk
item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

i remember when i was around 7. every time for the past 1-2 weeks, i used to go to sleep and see trees. i could hold these trees (they had no branches) and i could feel the weight in my palms, then i would wake up crying.

Read full topic

item.title: Lucid Dreaming
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

When I was little, the day my dad got a new car, in my dreams I was driving it. I was also getting chased by police (too much GTA). I forced myself to wake up because I didn’t want to destroy his new car… I’d also dream about drowning every single night until I finally realized I could breathe underwater in my dream. Don’t know if this counts but whatever

Read full topic

item.title: Lucid Dreaming
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“BitchPk, post:46, topic:441739”]anyone saw insidious??
I’ve read anywhere on a lucid dream forum or something that the movie Insidious (is fiction ofcourse) but it has a source of truth in it.

That other Souls can try rushing into it, if you go to far.
The forums said:“You are leaving your body with your soul and making time/dream/dimension travels”
but if you go to far, other souls can claim your living body.

Idk if this this is true, but it made me never try it.[/quote] Its apparently true, as several websites citing information about lucid dreams may include information about “scouts” that can bring you the the “Realm of Inorganic Beings” which is apparently like a cave network in a sponge. I’d like to try to get there, but I’ll need to be lucid first and remember to find a scout.

Scouts are also oddly placed objects in dreams. Once you get better and becoming lucid, they are supposed to be what cause it due to them not fitting in at all.

Read full topic

item.title: Lucid Dreaming
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:

All of their movies have the smallest shred of truth to make it more scary. My brother couldn’t wrap his head around the fact that it wasn’t real.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:42, topic:441739”]If you can’t remember your dreams, can you lucid dream? For I hardly ever remember my dreams.[/quote]This happens to me sometimes, but I usually remember that I had a particular dream once something triggers my memory, such as a word or sound. Then I can remember if I had a lucid dream or not .
